channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As measles spreads, federal budget cuts force closure of vaccine clinics
item.description: Federal funding cuts, though temporarily blocked by a judge, have upended vaccination outreach across the country, including in Arizona, Minnesota, Ne...

item.title: Asia markets soar after President Trump pauses global tariffs
item.description: Asia markets followed Wall Street's gains after Trump announced a pause on higher global tariffs, but investors are still looking to Beijing for react...

item.title: Pain pathway in a dish could aid search for new analgesic drugs
item.description: Scientists have recreated a pathway that senses pain, using clusters of human nerve cells grown in a dish.

item.title: Healing soup recipes, Part 2: Definitely not your grandma's chicken soup!
item.description: The second installment of our soup-a-thon. Vicky Hallett and Genevieve Villamora, correspondents. Marc Silver, digital editor. Radio interview ran las...

item.title: Trump's 90-day pause on tariffs. And, how free speech in public schools has changed
item.description: Yesterday, Trump abruptly announced a pause to big, sweeping tariff hikes for most countries. And, teachers across the U.S. share how freedom of speec...

item.title: Teen shark attack survivor presses lawmakers for new alert system
item.description: Lulu Gribbin, now 16, was one of three people bitten by a shark during a string of attacks off the Florida Panhandle. She lost her left hand and a por...

item.title: Zelensky claims 155 Chinese fighting for Russia in Ukraine
item.description: It follows Beijing's denial that many of its citizens are involved in the conflict.

item.title: Zimbabwe makes first compensation payments to white farmers over land grabs
item.description: This is the first payment under a deal aimed at helping Zimbabwe mend its relations with the West.

item.title: Woman jailed over £39 donation to Ukraine freed in US-Russia prisoner swap
item.description: Russian-American Ksenia Karelina was released by Moscow in return for the freeing of Russian-German Arthur Petrov.

item.title: Girl, 17, whose dad is lost in nightclub rubble spends birthday at scene
item.description: Shailyn Peña is one of many whose loved ones are missing after the roof of a nightclub collapsed in Santo Domingo.

item.title: World markets jump after Trump delays most tariff hikes, but not U.S. futures
item.description: Investors on overseas financial markets welcomed President Trump's decision to put most of his his sharp tariff hikes on hold for 90 days.

item.title: China says it's open to talks as Trump pauses tariffs on other nations
item.description: As Trump leaves China alone in facing high U.S. tariffs, Beijing says "the door to talks is open," but dialogue must come with "mutual respect."

item.title: Octavio Dotel, former MLB pitcher, dies in Dominican nightclub roof collapse
item.description: Former MLB players Octavio Dotel and Tony Blanco died after the roof of the Jet Set nightclub in Santo Domingo collapsed during a performance by meren...

item.title: Hopes fade of finding survivors of roof collapse at Santo Domingo nightclub
item.description: Rescue crews in the Dominican Republic dug through the remains of a legendary nightclub whose roof collapsed, but hopes of finding survivors were slim...

item.title: Sudan accuses UAE of 'complicity in genocide' at world court
item.description: Sudan's government alleges that the UAE is arming its civil war opponents, which it denies.

item.title: Trump’s new energy order puts states’ climate laws in the crosshairs of the Department of Justice
item.description: A new executive order from President Donald Trump that’s part of his effort to invigorate energy production launches the possibility that his Departme...

item.title: A California soccer coach charged in a 13-year-old’s death is accused of assaulting other teens
Americans convicted in Congo of a botched coup attempt now face US charges
